intro: Ceropegia sarkariae, commonly known as the Kashmir nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Kashmir region of India. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant produces violet-colored flowers that are often visited by nocturnal pollinators such as moths. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the cool, mountainous climate of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
